org.mellowtech.core.cache

Class AbstractCache<K,V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.mellowtech.core.cache.AbstractCache<K,V>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CacheLRU

    public abstract class AbstractCache<K,V>
extends Object
    Generic model for caches. The user of a cache provides a Remover function that is called everytime something is unloaded from cache. Also note that the remover function should only be called if the value of the key has been changed. A key that has been "put" into the cache more than one time (i.e. the key/value pair is update) is considerd to be changed.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Martin Svensson
    See Also:
    Remover

        public AbstractCache()

    • Method Detail

      • clearCache

        public abstract void clearCache()
        Clears the cache without calling any remover functions. Should be used with care

      • dirty

        public abstract void dirty(K key,
                           V value)
        Tell the cache that when removing this key from cache the remover's remove function should be called. Always call this method if the content in the value has changed. If the key has been unloaded the key/value is reinserted into the cache. The value will only be reinserted into the cache if the key did not exist. i.e. it is presumed that value object is the same as the old one.
        Parameters:
        key - the effect key
        value - the value that has been changed

      • notDirty

        public abstract void notDirty(K key)
        Describe notDirty method here.
        Parameters:
        key - an Object value

      • setRemover

        public void setRemover(Remover<K,V> remover)
        Describe setRemover method here.
        Parameters:
        remover - a Remover value

      • setLoader

        public void setLoader(Loader<K,V> loader)

      • emptyCache

        public void emptyCache()
        Empty the cache. For each item in the cache the Callback function will be called.

      • get

        public abstract V get(K key)
               throws NoSuchValueException
        Get a value
        Parameters:
        key - key to find
        Returns:
        value
        Throws:
        NoSuchValueException - if value is not present

        public abstract V getIfPresent(K key)

        public abstract V getFromCache(K key)
        Returns the value only if it is present in the cache
        Parameters:
        key - find
        Returns:
        value or null

      • isReadOnly

        public boolean isReadOnly()
        Checks if this cache is readOnly by checking if it does not have a remover function
        Returns:
        true if read only

      • iterator

        public abstract Iterator<Map.Entry<K,CacheValue<V>>> iterator()
        Return an iterator over the cache. The iterator is sorted over keys. The returned objects are Map.CompResult objects.
        Returns:
        a value of type 'Iterator'
        See Also:
        Map.Entry

      • put

        public abstract void put(K key,
                         V value)
        Put a key/value pair directly into the cache (bypassing any loaded value). If the value was previously in the cache its dirty bit should be set to true.
        Parameters:
        key - the key
        value - corresponding value, can be null

      • refresh

        public abstract void refresh(K key)
        Refresh a value in the cache by loading it again
        Parameters:
        key - key to load

      • remove

        public abstract void remove(K key)
        Removes a key/value pair from the cache.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to remove

      • setSize

        public abstract void setSize(long size)
        Set the new size of the cache. A negative value indicates a cache with no limit. If the new size is less than the oldsize keys should be removed from the cache.
        Parameters:
        size - can be negative

      • getCurrentSize

        public abstract long getCurrentSize()

      • maxSize

        public long maxSize()
        Return the maxCapacity of the cache. A negative value indicates a cache with no limit.
        Returns:
        an int value

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Prints each key/value pair in the cache by iterating over it.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        a value of type 'String'
